dimension:
6 1/2 x 7 1/8 in. (16.51 x 18.1 cm) (sheet, irregular)
15 9/16 x 14 3/8 in. (39.53 x 36.51 cm) (outer frame)
markings: on backing board: P. & D. Colnaghi dealer's label
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash over black and red chalk
provenance: Barozzi Collection, Venice. [Colnaghi, London; before 1968]. Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 7, 1999, no. 128, for £3, 450, to Flavia Ormand for Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1999-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
text: This playful sketch of weightless putti (cherubs) lifting a billowing cloth to the light puts the freedom of Giambattista Tiepolo’s penmanship and brushwork on full display. It has not been related to any finished work by Tiepolo, but it may have been a first thought for a titlepage to a book or as a way of including an inscription (appearing on the cloth) in a larger subject.
title: Putti Floating a Banner
